text: Dick Dowling is a 1905 marble sculpture of Confederate commander Richard W. Dowling by Frank Teich, previously installed in 1958 at the Cambridge Street entrance into Houston's Hermann Park, in the U.S. state of Texas. In June 2020, the memorial was removed in response to the George Floyd protests. ==History== The monument was publicly funded. Prior to 1958 the statue was at the city hall.Little, Carol Morris, A Comprehensive Guide to Outdoor Sculpture in Texas, University of Texas Press, Austin, 1996, pp. 272-273. On August 19, 2017, Andrew Schneck was arrested at the statue with bomb materials. ==See also== * 1905 in art * List of monuments and memorials removed during the George Floyd protests * List of public art in Houston ==References== Category:1905 establishments in Texas Category:1905 sculptures Category:Confederate States of America monuments and memorials in Texas Category:Hermann Park Category:Marble sculptures in Texas Category:Monuments and memorials removed during the George Floyd protests Category:Outdoor sculptures in Houston Category:Relocated buildings and structures in Texas Category:Sculptures of men in Texas Category:Statues in Houston
title: Statue of Richard W. Dowling
